sentences.en: "What do you want to know?"—"About life and stuff."
sentences.cn: “你想知道些什么？”——“关于生命之类的东西。”

sentences.en: all that running and swimming and stuff.
sentences.cn: 所有那些跑步、游泳之类的事。

sentences.en: all that running and swimming and stuff.
sentences.cn: 所有那些跑步、游泳之类的事。

sentences.en: Don't tell me you still believe in all that stuff?
sentences.cn: 别告诉我你仍旧相信那些东西。

sentences.en: He got up to strut his stuff on the dance-floor.
sentences.cn: 他起身到舞池里炫耀自己的舞技。

sentences.en: His love letters were hot stuff, apparently.
sentences.cn: 他的情书貌似写得很火辣。

sentences.en: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.cn: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.en: I called Andie to tell her how spectacular the stuff looked.
sentences.cn: 我打电话告诉安迪，那东西看上去太棒了。

sentences.en: I couldn't give a stuff what they think.
sentences.cn: 我才不在乎他们怎么想呢。

sentences.en: I don't want any more of that heavy stuff.
sentences.cn: 我再也不想碰那种麻烦事了。

sentences.en: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.cn: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.en: I mean, how could they possibly eat that stuff?
sentences.cn: 我的意思是，他们怎么可能吃那东西呢？

sentences.en: I stuffed my hands in my pockets.
sentences.cn: 我把双手塞进了我的口袋里。

sentences.en: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.cn: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.en: It's amazing how people collect so much stuff over the years.
sentences.cn: 人们竟然日积月累地收集了这么多东西，真令人惊叹。

sentences.en: Joseph made sure that he was never palmed off with inferior stuff.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫确保自己从不会被骗买一些次等原料。

sentences.en: Mister, can we 'elp to carry yer stuff in?
sentences.cn: 先生，要我们帮您把行李拿进去吗？

sentences.en: Radio Aire only plays Top 40 stuff and oldies.
sentences.cn: 空中电台仅播放排行榜上前40位的歌曲和怀旧金曲。

sentences.en: She stuffed two more sweaters into her bag.
sentences.cn: 她又往她的袋子里塞了两件毛线衫。

sentences.en: Stuff it, I'm 61, what do I care?.
sentences.cn: 别说了，我都61岁了，有什么可在乎的？。

sentences.en: Stuff your money. We don't want a handout.
sentences.cn: 收起你的钱，我们不需要施舍。

sentences.en: The stuff was selling like crazy.
sentences.cn: 这东西卖疯了。

sentences.en: These chaps know their stuff after seven years of war.
sentences.cn: 7年的战争过后，这些家伙都成了作战行家。

sentences.en: They insist on tastier chocolate than the anaemic British stuff.
sentences.cn: 他们坚持要比淡而无味的英国货味道更好的巧克力。

sentences.en: Volunteers were busy stuffing envelopes.
sentences.cn: 志愿者正忙着装信封。

sentences.en: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.cn: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

words.tran_cn: 填塞工；填充物；信件附页；（美）填塞走私犯；填充线

phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式)[生气或表示轻视]滚开，去你的
n. [俚]奇才；非凡的事物；黄色书籍或电影
(英，非正式)[表示漠不关心或轻视]毫不在乎，根本不当回事
adj. 很普通的；不足为奇的
(英，非正式)[表示冷漠、无奈或拒绝]够了！别说了！
用作加强语意词以表达极端之愤怒、懊恼或反感
(英，非正式)[表示赞扬]这就对了！好啊！

trans.tran_cn: 材料，原料，资料，〈俚〉钱，现金，填充物，素材资料
trans.tran_en: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are
to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way
to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way
